questions.questionText: Five athletes P, Q, R, S and T compete in a race. The table shows the finishing times for theathletes. athlete P Q R S T finishing time / s 22.50 24.40 25.20 26.50 23.20 Which statement is correct?

options.A: Athlete P won the race and was 0.70 s ahead of the athlete in second place.
options.B: Athlete P won the race and was 1.90 s ahead of the athlete in second place.
options.C: Athlete S won the race and was 1.30 s ahead of the athlete in second place.
options.D: Athlete S won the race and was 2.10 s ahead of the athlete in second place.

options.A: B

questions.questionText: Which statement about acceleration is correct?

options.A: It is related to the changing speed of an object.
options.B: It is the distance an object travels in one second.
options.C: It is the force acting on an object divided by the distance it travels in one second.
options.D:
It is the force acting on an object when it is near to the Earth.

questions.questionText: Two motors X and Y lift loads of the same weight through the same vertical distance. Motor X is more efficient than motor Y. Which statement about the motors is correct?

options.A: The useful energy output of motor X is larger than that of motor Y.
options.B: The useful energy output of motor X is smaller than that of motor Y.
options.C: The energy input of motor X is larger than that of motor Y.
options.D:
The energy input of motor X is smaller than that of motor Y.

options.B: Molecules that move from the liquid have the same energy as those that stay in the liquid.
options.C: The more energetic molecules escape the liquid.
options.D:
The more energetic molecules remain in the liquid.
